result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mary E Moton

records.addlTxt: No Contact Order from 9-20-2022 reinstated.  Defendant to have no contact with Shiloh Baptist Church, 4801 W. Capitol Dr., Milwaukee, SB, BR, VT, LW.

Defendant Mary E Moton in court.  Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court for Mary E Moton.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. State requested that the no contact order that was filed on 09/20/2022 be reinstated. Arguments heard. Court grants State's request.  Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact order with the church is modified to allow the defendant to attend services at Shiloh Baptist located at 4801 W Capitol Dr.

Defendant Mary E Moton appeared by video.  Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith appeared by video for Mary E Moton.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to Modify the Conditions of Bail: Modify No Contact Order to Allow Defendant to Attend Religious Services, filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Mary E Moton
Current: 7972 N 107th St. Unit 3, Milwaukee, WI 53224 United States  (Effective: 08-05-2022)
Prior: 4114 West Howard Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53221
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Shiloh Baptist Church, 4801 W. Capitol Dr., Milwaukee, SB, BR, VT, LW.

Defendant Mary E Moton in court.  Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court for Mary E Moton. Student Intern Kevin Clancy under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defense counsel contacted the Court via email requesting an adjournment. Court grants adjournment off the record. Parties advised of new date.
Received and Filed: Attorney Jonathan C. Smith

Adjustment Number: 22A 085350,
Payable Number: 1030188,
Receipt Number: 22RP035609,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/22/22 @ 1:30p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 9/22/22 @ 1:30p
